meanings.sent1: The indicters in the courtroom pointed at the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The police officer was one of the indicters in the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The indicters in the mystery novel turned out to be unexpected characters.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like indicters, revealing the truth hidden in his words.
meanings.sent5: The indicters wore stern expressions, making the accused nervous.

meanings.definition: Something that serves as evidence or a sign of something else.

meanings.sent3: The missing page in the book was an indicters of a secret message.
meanings.sent4: The old watch was an indicters of time passing by.
meanings.sent5: The wilted flowers were sad indicters of neglect.
